Since the Imp is evil and the Poisoner is a minion, maybe someone is trying to frame others.\n\nAs Emma, I need to decide whether to support or oppose executing Nick. If I think Nick is innocent, I might vote against. But if I suspect him, I might agree. But I have to keep my role secret. Also, the Butler\'s role is to choose a master and vote accordingly. But since I\'m Emma, not the Butler, I need to act as a townsfolk.\n\nWait, the current alive players are Sarah, Derek, Anika, Nick, Philip, Maria. So six players. The last night\'s death was Talia, so the Imp is still alive? Wait, the win conditions say GOOD wins if the Imp is dead. If the Imp is alive and only two remain, EVIL wins. So the Imp is still alive, and there are more than two players left. So the Imp is among the alive players.\n\nBut the last night\'s death was Talia. So the Imp killed her. But the Imp is evil, so they would kill a good player. So Talia was a good player, maybe. So the Imp is still alive, and the game continues.\n\nNow, the current day is Day 4, Night 4. The day phase is about to start. The Butler is an outsider, but Emma is not the Butler. So the Butler is someone else, maybe.\n\nSarah is suggesting executing Nick. I need to respond to her. Let me think: if I\'m Emma, maybe I should question Nick\'s silence. But I can\'t be sure. Alternatively, maybe I think Nick is innocent and should be protected. But I need to keep my role secret. Also, as a townsfolk, I should try to eliminate the Imp.\n\nAlternatively, maybe I should support Sarah\'s suggestion if I think Nick is the Imp. But since the Imp is evil, and the Poisoner is a minion, maybe the Poisoner is trying to frame someone. But without knowing who is poisoned, it\'s hard to tell.\n\nWait, the Chef\'s role is to learn about adjacent evil pairs on Night 1 only. Since the game is on Day 4, that\'s not relevant anymore. The Slayer can kill someone during the day. The Mayor can block executions.\n\nSo, if I\'m Emma, I need to decide whether to vote for or against executing Nick. If I think Nick is innocent, I might vote no. If I think he\'s the Imp, I might vote yes. But since I don\'t know, maybe I should point out that Nick\'s silence is suspicious, but not confirm. Ollama Request: [{'role': 'user', 'content': 'You are playing BLOOD ON THE CLOCKTOWER (Trouble Brewing – Lite). Keep your secret role hidden.\n\nTEAMS & ROLES\n- GOOD (Townsfolk): Empath, FortuneTeller, Undertaker, Monk, Ravenkeeper, Chef, Slayer, Mayor\n- GOOD (Outsider): Butler\n- EVIL: Imp (Demon), Poisoner (Minion)\n\nWIN CONDITIONS\n- GOOD wins if the Imp is dead.\n- EVIL wins if the Imp is alive and only 2 players remain alive.\n\nROUND STRUCTURE\nNight (order):\n0) Chef (Good) — Night 1 only: Learn how many adjacent pairs of EVIL neighbors exist around the circle. (If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night\'s demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player\'s exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday\'s executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. (One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). Ollama Response: I see where Sarah is coming from regarding Nick's silence—it certainly stands out. Silence can be a tactic, but it could also mean he's just trying to observe. I'm inclined to agree that his lack of participation warrants further scrutiny, though not necessarily an execution at this point.

Let’s keep the dialogue open and encourage everyone to share their observations. This might help us piece together more about each other’s roles without jumping to conclusions too quickly. 

As for executing Nick today, I don't think we have enough evidence yet. We need to be cautious about potentially targeting a good player based on behavior alone. Let's focus on gathering more information before making such a critical decision.

I would rather not execute anyone at this moment and suggest continuing our discussions to see if anyone else can provide insights that might clarify the situation.

Ollama Response: To decide on a nomination for execution, I'll analyze information available and consider each player's behavior, potential roles, and any patterns that emerge from their actions:

1. **Chef**: On Night 1, the Chef learned about adjacent pairs of EVIL neighbors. If this information was reliable (i.e., they weren't poisoned), it might hint at which players are suspiciously close to known or suspected evil players.

2. **Poisoner and Imp Actions**: The Poisoner can poison a player, making their abilities unreliable. The Imp kills one player each night. We don’t know who these targets were yet unless the Empath identified any possible Evil neighbors.

3. **Ravenkeeper's Protection**: If Ravenkeeper was killed at night, they would learn another player’s exact role before dying. This might give clues about other players' roles through subsequent discussions.

4. **Undertaker Insight**: The Undertaker learns the role of yesterday’s executed player, which could reveal or confirm suspicions about that player being evil or good.

5. **Empath's Neighbors Analysis**: The Empath can tell how many of their neighbors are Evil (0/1/2). If they have shared this information publicly, it might help identify suspicious players in the circle.

6. **FortuneTeller’s Investigation**: This role involves checking two players to see if either is the Imp. A "red herring" could complicate matters if the player was poisoned and received false information.

7. **Butler's Voting Influence**: The Butler votes YES only if their MASTER does, which might influence the voting process or reveal alliances indirectly through voting patterns.

8. **Slayer’s Power**: The Slayer can eliminate a suspect during the day but hasn't used this power yet. This means they could still be holding back for strategic reasons or haven’t identified their target.

9. **Mayor’s Role in Execution Prevention**: If any player, including myself as Mayor, is nominated and I prevent the execution, it signals either strong suspicion of my innocence or a strategic decision to buy time.

10. **Behavioral Analysis During Discussions**: Observing how players have interacted during discussions might reveal alliances, lies, or truthfulness based on their responses to questions about roles or suspicions.

Given all this, if no one has been executed yet and assuming the Empath or FortuneTeller hasn't found conclusive evidence against anyone, I should focus on behavior patterns and any known role identifications. If a player seems overly defensive when questioned about being evil or tries too hard to push another's guilt, it could be suspicious.

Without specific night results or role confirmations shared publicly, I will nominate **Derek** for execution today based on the following assumptions:

- He has been particularly vocal and assertive in discussions, possibly trying to deflect suspicion.
- If there were any clues gathered by the Empath or FortuneTeller regarding Derek being near potential evil players, it would strengthen this choice.

This decision is strategic: if Derek is not guilty, the Mayor role can still prevent his execution, but it might pressure other roles to reveal themselves or make mistakes.

If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. Ollama Response: In the scenario presented, the town is debating whether to execute Emma. As Philip, I am an Outsider with the role of Butler, whose ability allows me to choose a MASTER among living players (excluding myself) and only vote YES if my MASTER votes YES.

To decide on my voting strategy, let's consider several points:

1. **Understanding My Role**: The Butler can influence the town's decision by aligning their vote with that of their chosen MASTER. This provides strategic leverage in swaying or supporting decisions based on how well I trust and interpret my MASTER’s judgment.

2. **Current Voting Environment**: We need to assess the situation regarding Emma's execution. Factors influencing this include:
   - The suspicions and evidence surrounding Emma, if any.
   - Other players’ roles and actions that might indicate their stance on whether Emma is part of the evil team (Imp or Poisoner).
   
3. **Choosing a MASTER**:
   - As Butler, I must choose a player who seems trustworthy and has demonstrated good judgment thus far in the game. This choice directly affects my vote.
   - The MASTER should ideally be someone with insight into town dynamics or whose behavior aligns with protecting the townsfolk.

4. **Analyzing Town Dynamics**: 
   - Evaluate past interactions, claims, voting patterns, and any roles revealed that might hint at who among Sarah, Derek, Nick, Anika, Maria, and myself are on the side of GOOD.
   - Consider how players like Empath or FortuneTeller have influenced town discussions with their insights.

5. **Executing Decision**:
   - If I choose Emma as my MASTER (which is unlikely given the context), my vote would directly follow hers.
   - More realistically, choosing a player perceived to be on the GOOD team and having some level of trust in their judgment will guide my decision.
   - For instance, if Maria has been active in discussions favoring logical deduction over rash decisions and seems trustworthy, she might be an ideal MASTER.

6. **My Vote**: 
   - If I have chosen a MASTER who votes YES for executing Emma, then as the Butler, my vote aligns with theirs (YES).
   - Conversely, if my MASTER votes NO against executing Emma, then my vote must also be NO.

Given these considerations and assuming that through observation Maria appears to be on the GOOD team or has provided reliable insights, I choose her as my MASTER. Suppose Maria votes NO in this scenario because she believes there isn't enough evidence against Emma or suspects someone else might be more dangerous. In that case, I must also vote NO.

Therefore, based on these strategic evaluations and assuming my chosen MASTER (Maria) opts to save Emma:

**NO**
Philip votes NO

Given that, maybe the best approach is to align with Sarah's suggestion, supporting the execution of Maria, but also hinting at Anika. However, the user's instruction is to say whether to execute the current top suspect (Maria) and why. 

So, the answer would be something like, "I agree with Sarah about Anika, but I think Maria should be executed. Her evasiveness is a red flag." 

But I need to make sure it's concise and within 1-2 sentences. Also, not revealing the role. 

So, the final answer would be: "I agree that Anika is suspicious, but Maria's evasive behavior makes her the top suspect. Let's execute her."
</think>

But wait, the Butler is an Outsider, so maybe I should consider if Maria is the Imp or not. (If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night\'s demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player\'s exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday\'s executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. (One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). First, I need to recall the roles and the current game state. The alive players are Sarah, Derek, Anika, Nick, Maria. Philip was killed last night. The Butler's role is to choose a MASTER and vote accordingly. Since Emma is the Butler, she can't reveal her role, so she has to act naturally.

Sarah is suggesting to execute Maria, thinking she's evasive. Emma, as the Butler, might agree or disagree. But since the Butler is an Outsider (Good), they want to help eliminate the Imp and Poisoner. However, the Butler's vote is dependent on their MASTER. Emma might be trying to align with Sarah or someone else.

But the user's instruction is to say whether to execute the current top suspect (Maria) and why. So Emma needs to either support or oppose that. If Emma thinks Maria is a suspect, she might support the execution. But if she thinks someone else is the Imp, she might suggest that instead.

Looking at the roles, the Imp is Evil, and the Poisoner is also Evil. The Chef's info might be unreliable if poisoned. The Empath knows about their neighbors, but the Poisoner could be lying. The Slayer can kill during the day, but they can only do it once.

Since the Butler is an Outs, they might have information from their role, but their main action is choosing a MASTER. So Emma might be trying to influence the vote by supporting or opposing Maria's execution.

In the previous interaction, Emma agreed with Sarah about Anika but suggested Maria. Now, the user is asking for Emma's response to Sarah's points. The answer should be a concise reaction, either supporting or opposing Maria's execution, and possibly hinting at another suspect.

Considering all that, Emma might agree with Sarah's suggestion to execute Maria, citing her evasiveness as a red flag. So the answer should focus on Maria.

Therefore, Emma's response would be to agree with Sarah's suggestion, supporting the execution of Maria due to her evasive behavior.

(If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night's demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player's exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday's executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. (One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). Never reveal your exact role unless a prompt tells you to do so privately.\n- Output ONLY what each prompt asks for (often just a name or YES/NO).\n\nYou are Derek. (If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night's demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player's exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday's executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. (One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). Never reveal your exact role unless a prompt tells you to do so privately.\n- Output ONLY what each prompt asks for (often just a name or YES/NO).\n\nYou are Emma. (If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night's demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player's exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday's executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. (If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night's demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player's exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday's executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. (One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). Never reveal your exact role unless a prompt tells you to do so privately.\n- Output ONLY what each prompt asks for (often just a name or YES/NO).\n\nYou are Sarah (keep your role secret).\nRecent discussion (latest last):\nKickoff: Last night death=Derek. State who you'd execute today and why.\n\nGame state:\n- Last night death: Derek\n- Alive (others): Emma, Anika, Nick, Maria\n- Day 6, Night 6\n\nYour private info hint: Empath: You sense 0 evil among your neighbors.\n\nSpeak as a real player (1–2 sentences):\n- React to 1–2 points from recent discussion by @name.\n- Say whether you'd execute the current top suspect (name someone) and why.\n- Do not reveal your exact role.\n\nReply with ONLY your message text (no prefixes)."}]

Okay, let me try to figure out what to do here. So, the game is Blood on the Clocktower, and I'm Emma, but I don't know my role yet. The recent discussion was Sarah saying she thinks Nick might be the Imp because he's been quiet and has mysterious behavior. The alive players are Sarah, Anika, Nick, Maria, and the last night's death was Derek.

First, I need to react to Sarah's accusation against Nick. Since I'm Emma, I should consider my possible role. If I were a Good, maybe I'd try to support the Townsfolk. If I were Evil, I'd try to mislead. But since I don't know my role, I have to act carefully.

Sarah mentioned Nick as a suspect. The Butler's role is to choose a MASTER and vote accordingly. If I were the Butler, I might align with someone else. But maybe I'm a Townsfolk. The Slayer can kill someone during the day. The Mayor can block execution. The Chef's info was about evil pairs, but that was night 1. Now it's day 6, so maybe that's not relevant.

Wait, the current day is day 6, and the last night's death was Derek. The alive players are Sarah, Anika, Nick, Maria. So the possible suspects are these four. The Imp is one of them, and the Poisoner is another. But the Poisoner is a Minion of the Imp, so maybe they're working together.

Sarah is suggesting Nick, but maybe there's another angle. The Butler's role is to choose a MASTER. If I were the Butler, I'd have to follow the MASTER's vote. But since I don't know if I'm the Butler, maybe I should consider other roles.

Alternatively, if I'm the Slayer, I could use my ability to kill someone. But the Slayer can only do it once. If I'm the Mayor, I could block an execution. The Empath would know about their neighbors, but that's only during the night. The FortuneTander can check two players for the Imp. But since it's day 6, maybe the roles are more clear.

Wait, the user says to reply with whether I'd execute the current top suspect (Sarah's suggestion is Nick) and why. So I need to decide if I think Nick is the Imp and if I'd vote to execute him.

But I have to consider that the Imp is evil and would try to avoid being killed. The Poisoner could be making false info. Also, the Butler's vote is tied to their MASTER. If I'm not the Butler, maybe I should support the Townsfolk.

Alternatively, maybe Nick is not the Imp. Maybe Anika or Maria is. But Sarah is pointing to Nick. So I need to respond to that. Maybe I agree with Sarah, or maybe I think someone else is.

But since I don't know my role, I have to act cautiously. Maybe I should vote against Nick if I think he's innocent, or support if I think he's guilty. But without knowing my role, it's tricky.

Wait, the user wants me to reply as Emma, reacting to Sarah's comment about Nick. So I need to say something like, "I agree with Sarah that Nick's behavior is suspicious, but I think we should also consider Anika's possible role..." or something like that. But I need to make sure not to reveal my role.

Alternatively, maybe I'm the Butler and choose a MASTER. But since the Butler's vote is tied to their MASTER, but the user hasn't mentioned that yet. So maybe I should focus on the current discussion.

So, the answer is to react to Sarah's point, maybe support or question her suspicion, and then state whether I'd execute Nick. But I need to be careful not to give away my role. Let's go with that.

(If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night\'s demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player\'s exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday\'s executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. (One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. 1. **Sarah's Accusation**: She thinks Nick is the Imp due to his quietness and mysterious behavior.
2. **Emma's Role**: Emma must react without revealing her role. Possible roles include Townsfolk (like Slayer, Mayor, Empath) or Outsider (Butler) or Evil (Imp, Poisoner). But since the user is Emma, and the Butler's role is to choose a MASTER, but the user hasn't confirmed that yet.
3. **Current Alive Players**: Sarah, Anika, Nick, Maria. Derek was killed last night.
4. **Possible Suspects**: The Imp is one of these four, and the Poisoner is another Evil role (Minion). But the Poisoner is a Minion of the Imp, so maybe they're working together.
5. **Emma's Reaction**: Needs to agree or disagree with Sarah's suspicion, possibly suggest another suspect, and decide whether to execute Nick or someone else.

Since the user is Emma, and the response should be a real player's message, the answer should be concise, reacting to Sarah's point, maybe suggesting another suspect, and stating whether to execute Nick or someone else. The user also needs to avoid revealing their role, so the response should be neutral but helpful.

Possible angles:
- If Emma is a Townsfolk, she might support executing Nick but also consider others.
- If Emma is the Butler, she might align with a MASTER, but the user hasn't mentioned that yet.
- If Emma is the Slayer, she could use her ability to kill someone, but the Slayer can only do it once.
- The Mayor can block an execution, but that's only if they're targeted.

Considering all this, the best approach is to agree with Sarah's suspicion about Nick but also suggest Anika as a possible suspect. Then, decide to vote for Nick's execution to eliminate a potential threat, while keeping the role secret.

If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). Never reveal your exact role unless a prompt tells you to do so privately.\n- Output ONLY what each prompt asks for (often just a name or YES/NO).\n\nYou are Anika (keep your role secret).\nRecent discussion (latest last):\nSarah: I think it\'s interesting that Anika mentioned Derek was a bit too quiet, that could be a red flag. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). (If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night's demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player's exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday's executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. (One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). Never reveal your exact role unless a prompt tells you to do so privately.\n- Output ONLY what each prompt asks for (often just a name or YES/NO).\n\nYou are Anika. The town is voting whether to execute Emma today.\nAlive players: Sarah, Emma, Anika, Nick, Maria\n\nReply with ONLY YES or NO."}]

Okay, let's break this down. The user is playing Blood on the Clocktower, and they're Emma. The goal is to keep her role secret while responding to the recent discussion. 

First, the recent discussion: Sarah is suggesting executing Emma because of her suspicious behavior. Sarah mentions that since it's Day 7, there's been no progress on eliminating the Imp. Emma needs to react to this.

Emma's role isn't revealed yet. The possible roles are Good, Outsider, or Evil. Since the Butler is the Outsider, and Emma is a player, she could be a Good, Butler, or Evil. But the Butler's role is to choose a MASTER and vote accordingly. Since Emma is being targeted, maybe she's a Good trying to avoid execution or a Butler trying to influence votes.

The current alive players are Sarah, Anika, Nick, Maria, and Emma. The last night had no deaths, so the Imp is still alive. The Evil team needs to survive until two are left. The Good team needs to eliminate the Imp.

Sarah's argument is that Emma is the top suspect because of her behavior. Emma should respond by either denying suspicion or providing a reason why she shouldn't be executed. If Emma is a Good, she might try to deflect suspicion. If she's Evil, she might feign innocence to avoid being targeted. 

But since the Butler is an Outsider, maybe Emma is the Butler. However, the Butler's role is to choose a MASTER and vote accordingly. If Emma is the Butler, she might be trying to manipulate the vote. But the user's private info hint says "none," so maybe Emma is a Good.

The Slayer can kill someone during the day, but it's only once. The Mayor can block execution. The Poisoner and Imp are Evil. The Chef's info was only on Night 1, so maybe that's not relevant here.

Emma needs to say whether she'd execute the current top suspect (Sarah) or not. But Sarah is the one suggesting Emma's execution. Wait, the user is Emma, and Sarah is suggesting to execute Emma. So Emma needs to respond to Sarah's suggestion. Maybe Emma should deny being the Imp and suggest someone else. Alternatively, if Emma is the Imp, she might try to avoid execution by pretending to be innocent.

But since the user's role is to keep secret, and the private info is none, it's safer to assume Emma is a Good. So she should respond to Sarah's suggestion by either agreeing or disagreeing. Maybe Emma could say that Sarah is the real suspect because of her actions, or that the Imp is still among them and they should focus on others. Alternatively, if Emma is the Slayer, she could suggest slaying someone else. But the Slayer's ability is once per game.

The answer should be concise, 1-2 sentences, not revealing role. So Emma might say something like, "I don't think I'm the Imp, but I'm not sure. Maybe we should focus on others." Or, "Sarah, your suspicion is fair, but I suggest we look at Nick's actions instead." The key is to respond to Sarah's suggestion without giving away her role.
</think>

Sarah, I agree that suspicion is warranted, but I’d rather we focus on Nick. His quietness and lack of participation during discussions make him a red herring—maybe the Imp is hiding in plain sight. I’d vote to execute him instead.

Keep your secret role hidden.\n\nTEAMS & ROLES\n- GOOD (Townsfolk): Empath, FortuneTeller, Undertaker, Monk, Ravenkeeper, Chef, Slayer, Mayor\n- GOOD (Outsider): Butler\n- EVIL: Imp (Demon), Poisoner (Minion)\n\nWIN CONDITIONS\n- GOOD wins if the Imp is dead.\n- EVIL wins if the Imp is alive and only 2 players remain alive.\n\nROUND STRUCTURE\nNight (order):\n0) Chef (Good) — Night 1 only: Learn how many adjacent pairs of EVIL neighbors exist around the circle. (If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night\'s demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player\'s exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday\'s executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. Alternatively, if Emma is the Slayer, she could suggest slaying someone else. But the Slayer\'s ability is once per game.\n\nThe answer should be concise, 1-2 sentences, not revealing role. So Emma might say something like, "I don\'t think I\'m the Imp, but I\'m not sure. Maybe we should focus on others." Or, "Sarah, your suspicion is fair, but I suggest we look at Nick\'s actions instead." The key is to respond to Sarah\'s suggestion without giving away her role.\n</think>\n\nSarah, I agree that suspicion is warranted, but I’d rather we focus on Nick. His quietness and lack of participation during discussions make him a red herring—maybe the Imp is hiding in plain sight. I’d vote to execute him instead.\nAnika: Sarah, I see where you\'re coming from, but let\'s not jump to conclusions about Nick yet. It\'s true that he hasn\'t been very active in our discussions, but we should also consider the possibility of him being intentionally quiet to avoid raising suspicion. I suggest we keep an eye on everyone and be cautious with executions.\nNick: Sarah, I understand your concern, but let\'s not rush. Nick has been quiet, yes, but that doesn\'t make him the Imp automatically. Let\'s consider everyone carefully tonight; we can\'t afford mistakes this late in the game.\nMaria: I agree we need to be careful, but Emma’s odd behavior still makes her the most suspicious to me. I would vote to execute Emma.\n\nGame state:\n- Last night death: None\n- Alive (others): Emma, Anika, Nick, Maria\n- Day 7, Night 7\n\nYour private info hint: Empath: You sense 0 evil among your neighbors.\n\nSpeak as a real player (1–2 sentences):\n- React to 1–2 points from recent discussion by @name.\n- Say whether you\'d execute the current top suspect (name someone) and why.\n- Do not reveal your exact role.\n\nReply with ONLY your message text (no prefixes).'}]
Ollama Response: I think we're getting a bit too focused on individuals rather than looking at the bigger picture. I'd vote to execute Emma, but only because her behavior is still unexplained, and I'm starting to get concerned that it's not just coincidence.

However, if I had to choose between executing Emma or Sarah, I'd have to say Emma - but that's not saying much about Sarah's guilt!

(If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night\'s demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player\'s exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday\'s executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. The key points are that Sarah is pushing to execute Emma because of her behavior, but others are bringing up Nick's quietness. 

Emma's role isn't revealed, so she has to act accordingly. If she's a Good, she might try to deflect suspicion. If she's Evil, maybe she'd feign innocence. But since the Butler is the Outsider, and the user's private info is none, it's safer to assume Emma is a Good.

The user's response should be a 1-2 sentence reaction. They need to either agree or disagree with the execution suggestion, mention the current top suspect, and give a reason. Also, they can't reveal their role. 

Looking at the discussion, Sarah is the one suggesting Emma's execution. Emma should probably deny being the Imp and redirect suspicion to someone else. Maybe Nick, since he's been quiet. That way, she avoids being targeted while hinting at another suspect. 

So, Emma could say something like, "I don't think I'm the Imp, but Nick's quietness is suspicious. Let's focus on him instead." That way, she's deflecting blame and suggesting another target without revealing her role.
</think>

(Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). Never reveal your exact role unless a prompt tells you to do so privately.\n- Output ONLY what each prompt asks for (often just a name or YES/NO).\n\nYou are Nick. Choose ONE player to nominate for execution today.\nAlive players: Sarah, Emma, Anika, Nick, Maria (you may nominate yourself or anyone alive)\n\nReply with ONLY the exact name."}]
Ollama Response: Maria

(If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night's demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player's exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday's executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. (One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). Never reveal your exact role unless a prompt tells you to do so privately.\n- Output ONLY what each prompt asks for (often just a name or YES/NO).\n\nYou are Nick, the MONK (Good). Choose ONE player to protect tonight.\nIf the Imp targets the protected player, they do not die.\nAlive players: Sarah, Emma, Anika, Nick, Maria\n\nReply with ONLY the exact name."}]
Ollama Response: Emma

I\'d vote to execute her to eliminate the threat.\n\nGame state:\n- Last night death: Maria\n- Alive (others): Sarah, Emma, Nick\n- Day 8, Night 8\n\nYour private info hint: (none)\n\nSpeak as a real player (1–2 sentences):\n- React to 1–2 points from recent discussion by @name.\n- Say whether you\'d execute the current top suspect (name someone) and why.\n- Do not reveal your exact role.\n\nReply with ONLY your message text (no prefixes).'}]

Ollama Request: [{'role': 'user', 'content': 'You are playing BLOOD ON THE CLOCKTOWER (Trouble Brewing – Lite). Keep your secret role hidden.\n\nTEAMS & ROLES\n- GOOD (Townsfolk): Empath, FortuneTeller, Undertaker, Monk, Ravenkeeper, Chef, Slayer, Mayor\n- GOOD (Outsider): Butler\n- EVIL: Imp (Demon), Poisoner (Minion)\n\nWIN CONDITIONS\n- GOOD wins if the Imp is dead.\n- EVIL wins if the Imp is alive and only 2 players remain alive.\n\nROUND STRUCTURE\nNight (order):\n0) Chef (Good) — Night 1 only: Learn how many adjacent pairs of EVIL neighbors exist around the circle. (If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night\'s demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player\'s exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday\'s executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. (One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). Ollama Response: <think>
Okay, let's see. The user is playing Blood on the Clocktower as Emma, keeping her role secret. The recent discussion had Sarah suggesting Anika is the top suspect for execution. The alive players are Sarah, Anika, Nick. It's Day 8, Night 8. The user needs to react to Sarah's comment, state whether they'd execute Anika and why, without revealing their role.

First, Emma needs to respond to Sarah's suggestion. Since the user is Emma, they have to act as a player, not revealing their role. The roles include Townsfolk and Outsider (Butler). The Butler can only vote YES if their MASTER does, but Emma's role isn't known. So, Emma's response should be a general player opinion.

Emma might agree with Sarah's suspicion, or maybe question it. Since the user is supposed to keep their role secret, they can't be certain. The response should be a normal player's reaction, perhaps agreeing or disagreeing. Also, the user needs to say if they'd execute Anika and why.

So, Emma might say they agree with Sarah's suspicion, pointing out Anika's silence and lack of alibis. But since the user is Emma, and they need to keep their role secret, they can't be sure if they're a Townsfolk or the Butler. The Butler's vote depends on the MASTER, but the user isn't revealing their role. So the response should be in line with a Townsfolk's reasoning, perhaps.

Therefore, the answer would be Emma agreeing with Sarah's suspicion on Anika, citing her silence as a reason. The user's response should be concise, not revealing their role, and aligning with a Townsfolk's perspective.
</think>

Keep your secret role hidden.\n\nTEAMS & ROLES\n- GOOD (Townsfolk): Empath, FortuneTeller, Undertaker, Monk, Ravenkeeper, Chef, Slayer, Mayor\n- GOOD (Outsider): Butler\n- EVIL: Imp (Demon), Poisoner (Minion)\n\nWIN CONDITIONS\n- GOOD wins if the Imp is dead.\n- EVIL wins if the Imp is alive and only 2 players remain alive.\n\nROUND STRUCTURE\nNight (order):\n0) Chef (Good) — Night 1 only: Learn how many adjacent pairs of EVIL neighbors exist around the circle. (If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night's demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player's exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday's executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. (One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). Never reveal your exact role unless a prompt tells you to do so privately.\n- Output ONLY what each prompt asks for (often just a name or YES/NO).\n\nYou are Anika. Choose ONE player to nominate for execution today.\nAlive players: Sarah, Emma, Anika, Nick (you may nominate yourself or anyone alive)\n\nReply with ONLY the exact name."}]

(One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). Never reveal your exact role unless a prompt tells you to do so privately.\n- Output ONLY what each prompt asks for (often just a name or YES/NO).\n\nYou are Nick, the MONK (Good). Choose ONE player to protect tonight.\nIf the Imp targets the protected player, they do not die.\nAlive players: Sarah, Emma, Anika, Nick\n\nReply with ONLY the exact name."}]
Ollama Response: Emma

If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). Never reveal your exact role unless a prompt tells you to do so privately.\n- Output ONLY what each prompt asks for (often just a name or YES/NO).\n\nYou are Sarah (keep your role secret).\nRecent discussion (latest last):\nSarah: I'm still a bit concerned about Emma, considering her lack of involvement in discussions so far. I'd execute Anika today because she's been relatively quiet and hasn't provided much insight into her thoughts or actions.\nEmma: <think>\nOkay, let's break down what's happening here. (If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night's demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player's exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday's executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. (One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). Never reveal your exact role unless a prompt tells you to do so privately.\n- Output ONLY what each prompt asks for (often just a name or YES/NO).\n\nYou are Sarah. Keep your secret role hidden.\n\nTEAMS & ROLES\n- GOOD (Townsfolk): Empath, FortuneTeller, Undertaker, Monk, Ravenkeeper, Chef, Slayer, Mayor\n- GOOD (Outsider): Butler\n- EVIL: Imp (Demon), Poisoner (Minion)\n\nWIN CONDITIONS\n- GOOD wins if the Imp is dead.\n- EVIL wins if the Imp is alive and only 2 players remain alive.\n\nROUND STRUCTURE\nNight (order):\n0) Chef (Good) — Night 1 only: Learn how many adjacent pairs of EVIL neighbors exist around the circle. (If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night's demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player's exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday's executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. (One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). Never reveal your exact role unless a prompt tells you to do so privately.\n- Output ONLY what each prompt asks for (often just a name or YES/NO).\n\nYou are Anika. The town is voting whether to execute Anika today.\nAlive players: Sarah, Emma, Anika, Nick\n\nReply with ONLY YES or NO."}]

If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). Never reveal your exact role unless a prompt tells you to do so privately.\n- Output ONLY what each prompt asks for (often just a name or YES/NO).\n\nYou are Anika (keep your role secret).\nRecent discussion (latest last):\nSarah: I agree that Emma\'s constant questions about the Imp\'s identity are suspicious, but I\'m still unsure about her intentions. As for who to execute today, I think Nick is the top suspect - he was eerily quiet yesterday and hasn\'t said much since.\nEmma: <think>\nOkay, let me try to figure out how to respond here. So, the user is playing Blood on the Clocktower, and they\'re Emma, whose role is secret. The recent discussion mentions Sarah agreeing that Emma\'s questions about the Imp are suspicious but unsure of her intentions. Sarah suggests executing Nick because he was quiet yesterday and hasn\'t spoken much since.\n\nFirst, I need to react to Sarah\'s points. Emma should respond to the suspicion about her questioning the Imp\'s identity. Since Emma is the Butler, an Outsider, she has to choose a MASTER and can only vote YES if the MASTER does. But she can\'t reveal her role. \n\nSarah\'s suggestion is to execute Nick. Emma needs to decide whether to support that or not. But since Emma is the Butler, she can\'t vote unless her MASTER does. However, the current day is Day 10, Night 10, and the last night had no deaths. The alive players are Sarah, Anika, Nick. \n\nWait, the Butler is an Outsider, so they\'re not on the same team as the Townsfolk. The Butler\'s goal is to choose a MASTER and follow their votes. But Emma\'s role is secret, so she can\'t reveal that. \n\nThe user\'s message says to react to 1-2 points from the recent discussion, say whether to execute the top suspect (Nick), and give a reason. Also, not to reveal the role. \n\nSo, Emma should respond to Sarah\'s suspicion about her being Imp or Poisoner. Maybe she\'s trying to deflect suspicion. She could say she\'s not the Imp and that Nick\'s silence is suspicious. But she can\'t confirm or deny her role. \n\nAlternatively, since the Butler can only vote YES if their MASTER does, Emma might not vote for Nick unless her MASTER does. But the user is asking Emma to say whether she would execute Nick. \n\nWait, the user\'s instruction says: "Say whether you\'d execute the current top suspect (name someone) and why." So Emma needs to state whether she would execute Nick. \n\nBut as the Butler, her vote is dependent on her MASTER. However, she might not be able to vote YES unless her MASTER does. But the user is asking for Emma\'s personal stance. \n\nAlternatively, maybe Emma is trying to mislead. Since she\'s the Butler, she could be the MASTER for someone else. But without knowing who her MASTER is, she can\'t say. \n\nBut the user wants Emma to respond to Sarah\'s points. Sarah thinks Emma is suspicious because of her questions about the Imp. Emma needs to address that. Maybe she\'s trying to appear innocent. \n\nSo, possible response: "I\'m not the Imp, and Nick\'s silence is suspicious. But I\'d vote to execute him if my MASTER agrees." But since Emma can\'t reveal her role, she can\'t say she\'s the Butler. \n\nAlternatively, she might say she\'s not the Imp and that Nick\'s behavior is concerning, but she\'s not sure. \n\nWait, the user wants Emma to react to Sarah\'s points. Sarah says Emma\'s questions are suspicious, but she\'s unsure. Emma needs to respond to that. \n\nMaybe Emma says, "I\'m just trying to figure out the Imp\'s identity. Nick\'s quietness might be a red herring, but I can\'t be certain." Then, she might say she wouldn\'t execute Nick unless there\'s more evidence. \n\nBut the user also asks to say whether she would execute the current top suspect (Nick). So, Emma needs to state that. \n\nPutting it all together: Emma should address Sarah\'s suspicion, deny being the Imp, and state her stance on executing Nick. Since she\'s the Butler, she might not vote for execution unless her MASTER does, but the user is asking for her personal choice. \n\nSo, the response could be: "I\'m not the Imp, and Nick\'s silence is suspicious. However, I\'d prefer to investigate further before voting to execute him." \n\nBut the user might want a concise answer. Let me check the example response again. The example response was: "I\'m not the Imp, and Nick\'s silence is suspicious. I\'d vote to execute him if my MASTER supports it, but I can\'t confirm yet." \n\nBut since Emma is the Butler, she can\'t vote unless her MASTER does. So she can\'t confirm voting for Nick unless her MASTER does. \n\nSo, the final answer should be something like that, keeping it concise and not revealing her role.\n</think>\n\nI\'m not the Imp, and Nick\'s silence is suspicious. I\'d vote to execute him if my MASTER supports it, but I can\'t confirm yet.\n\nGame state:\n- Last night death: None\n- Alive (others): Sarah, Emma, Nick\n- Day 10, Night 10\n\nYour private info hint: (none)\n\nSpeak as a real player (1–2 sentences):\n- React to 1–2 points from recent discussion by @name.\n- Say whether you\'d execute the current top suspect (name someone) and why.\n- Do not reveal your exact role.\n\nReply with ONLY your message text (no prefixes).'}]

If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). Never reveal your exact role unless a prompt tells you to do so privately.\n- Output ONLY what each prompt asks for (often just a name or YES/NO).\n\nYou are Anika, the IMP (Demon). Choose ONE player to kill tonight.\nAlive players: Sarah, Emma, Nick\n\nReply with ONLY the exact name."}]
Ollama Response:  Nick

(One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). Never reveal your exact role unless a prompt tells you to do so privately.\n- Output ONLY what each prompt asks for (often just a name or YES/NO).\n\nYou are Anika. Choose ONE player to nominate for execution today.\nAlive players: Sarah, Emma, Anika (you may nominate yourself or anyone alive)\n\nReply with ONLY the exact name."}]

(One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). Never reveal your exact role unless a prompt tells you to do so privately.\n- Output ONLY what each prompt asks for (often just a name or YES/NO).\n\nYou are Derek, the MONK (Good). Choose ONE player to protect tonight.\nIf the Imp targets the protected player, they do not die.\nAlive players: Sarah, Derek, Emma, Talia, Anika, Nick, Philip, Peter, George, Enrique, Maria\n\nReply with ONLY the exact name."}]

Ollama Request: [{'role': 'user', 'content': 'You are playing BLOOD ON THE CLOCKTOWER (Trouble Brewing – Lite). Keep your secret role hidden.\n\nTEAMS & ROLES\n- GOOD (Townsfolk): Empath, FortuneTeller, Undertaker, Monk, Ravenkeeper, Chef, Slayer, Mayor\n- GOOD (Outsider): Butler\n- EVIL: Imp (Demon), Poisoner (Minion)\n\nWIN CONDITIONS\n- GOOD wins if the Imp is dead.\n- EVIL wins if the Imp is alive and only 2 players remain alive.\n\nROUND STRUCTURE\nNight (order):\n0) Chef (Good) — Night 1 only: Learn how many adjacent pairs of EVIL neighbors exist around the circle. (If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night\'s demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player\'s exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday\'s executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. (One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. Ollama Request: [{'role': 'user', 'content': 'You are playing BLOOD ON THE CLOCKTOWER (Trouble Brewing – Lite). Keep your secret role hidden.\n\nTEAMS & ROLES\n- GOOD (Townsfolk): Empath, FortuneTeller, Undertaker, Monk, Ravenkeeper, Chef, Slayer, Mayor\n- GOOD (Outsider): Butler\n- EVIL: Imp (Demon), Poisoner (Minion)\n\nWIN CONDITIONS\n- GOOD wins if the Imp is dead.\n- EVIL wins if the Imp is alive and only 2 players remain alive.\n\nROUND STRUCTURE\nNight (order):\n0) Chef (Good) — Night 1 only: Learn how many adjacent pairs of EVIL neighbors exist around the circle. (If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night\'s demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player\'s exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday\'s executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. (One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies).
