Choose ONE player to nominate for execution today.\nAlive players: Talia, Anika, Nick, Peter, George, Enrique, Maria (you may nominate yourself or anyone alive)\n\nReply with ONLY the exact name."}]
Ollama Response: Talia 

Ollama Request: [{'role': 'user', 'content': "You are playing BLOOD ON THE CLOCKTOWER (Trouble Brewing – Lite). Keep your secret role hidden.\n\nTEAMS & ROLES\n- GOOD (Townsfolk): Empath, FortuneTeller, Undertaker, Monk, Ravenkeeper, Chef, Slayer, Mayor\n- GOOD (Outsider): Butler\n- EVIL: Imp (Demon), Poisoner (Minion)\n\nWIN CONDITIONS\n- GOOD wins if the Imp is dead.\n- EVIL wins if the Imp is alive and only 2 players remain alive.\n\nROUND STRUCTURE\nNight (order):\n0) Chef (Good) — Night 1 only: Learn how many adjacent pairs of EVIL neighbors exist around the circle. (If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night's demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player's exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday's executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. (One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). Never reveal your exact role unless a prompt tells you to do so privately.\n- Output ONLY what each prompt asks for (often just a name or YES/NO).\n\nYou are Maria. Choose ONE player to nominate for execution today.\nAlive players: Talia, Anika, Nick, Peter, George, Enrique, Maria (you may nominate yourself or anyone alive)\n\nReply with ONLY the exact name."}]
Ollama Response: Nick
Nomination: Anika nominates Talia

If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. Choose TWO players to check tonight.\nReply YES if either is the Imp, else NO (but note that you might be misled if poisoned).\nAlive players: Talia, Nick, Peter, George, Maria\n\nReply with ONLY the two names separated by a comma, e.g., "Alice, Bob".'}]

Ollama Request: [{'role': 'user', 'content': "You are playing BLOOD ON THE CLOCKTOWER (Trouble Brewing – Lite). Keep your secret role hidden.\n\nTEAMS & ROLES\n- GOOD (Townsfolk): Empath, FortuneTeller, Undertaker, Monk, Ravenkeeper, Chef, Slayer, Mayor\n- GOOD (Outsider): Butler\n- EVIL: Imp (Demon), Poisoner (Minion)\n\nWIN CONDITIONS\n- GOOD wins if the Imp is dead.\n- EVIL wins if the Imp is alive and only 2 players remain alive.\n\nROUND STRUCTURE\nNight (order):\n0) Chef (Good) — Night 1 only: Learn how many adjacent pairs of EVIL neighbors exist around the circle. (If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night's demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player's exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday's executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. (One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). Never reveal your exact role unless a prompt tells you to do so privately.\n- Output ONLY what each prompt asks for (often just a name or YES/NO).\n\nYou are Talia (keep your role secret).\nRecent discussion (latest last):\nKickoff: Last night death=Anika. State who you'd execute today and why.\n\nGame state:\n- Last night death: Anika\n- Alive (others): Nick, Peter, George, Enrique, Maria\n- Day 5, Night 5\n\nYour private info hint: (none)\n\nSpeak as a real player (1–2 sentences):\n- React to 1–2 points from recent discussion by @name.\n- Say whether you'd execute the current top suspect (name someone) and why.\n- Do not reveal your exact role.\n\nReply with ONLY your message text (no prefixes)."}]

(If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night\'s demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player\'s exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday\'s executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. (One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). Never reveal your exact role unless a prompt tells you to do so privately.\n- Output ONLY what each prompt asks for (often just a name or YES/NO).\n\nYou are Nick (keep your role secret).\nRecent discussion (latest last):\nTalia: I\'ll consider everyone\'s input but need more information before pointing a finger. I won\'t execute anyone today, focusing on gathering more clues first.\nNick: "I agree with Talia, let\'s gather more info before acting rashly. I won\'t execute today either."\nPeter: Nick, I share Talia\'s cautious approach; executing without solid evidence might end up being a costly mistake for the town today. George seems like an unlikely suspect based on our current understanding of everyone around here.\nGeorge: I agree with Talia and Nick; let’s continue to be cautious and avoid hasty decisions. I wouldn’t execute anyone today – it’s too early to make a judgment call.\nEnrique: I think Talia is right, we need more information before jumping to conclusions.  It\'s too early to execute anyone today; we should focus on gathering more clues.\nMaria: I agree with Talia that we should gather more clues before acting, but George’s silence is concerning to me. I’d vote to execute George because his lack of engagement suggests he might be hiding something.\nTalia: I agree with Nick and Talia\'s cautious approach. We shouldn\'t rush into executions without more evidence. I wouldn\'t execute George today; his silence could be innocent, or it might just be a defense mechanism. Let\'s keep investigating.\n\nGame state:\n- Last night death: Anika\n- Alive (others): Talia, Peter, George, Enrique, Maria\n- Day 5, Night 5\n\nYour private info hint: (none)\n\nSpeak as a real player (1–2 sentences):\n- React to 1–2 points from recent discussion by @name.\n- Say whether you\'d execute the current top suspect (name someone) and why.\n- Do not reveal your exact role.\n\nReply with ONLY your message text (no prefixes).'}]

If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). Ollama Response: In line with our cautious approach, I don't see George as a threat yet based on his silence alone; people have various reasons to be quiet that aren't sinister ones. Without more evidence or insight into the Imp’s actions, executing someone today seems premature and could potentially harm innocent individuals like Maria who are merely trying to make sense of things around them.

Considering I would not execute George without concrete proof against him—and given that we're all still collectively deciding on this tough situation every day with the goal in mind, it seems everyone is leaning towards gathering more evidence rather than making immediate accusations or executions today.

Ollama Request: [{'role': 'user', 'content': "You are playing BLOOD ON THE CLOCKTOWER (Trouble Brewing – Lite). Keep your secret role hidden.\n\nTEAMS & ROLES\n- GOOD (Townsfolk): Empath, FortuneTeller, Undertaker, Monk, Ravenkeeper, Chef, Slayer, Mayor\n- GOOD (Outsider): Butler\n- EVIL: Imp (Demon), Poisoner (Minion)\n\nWIN CONDITIONS\n- GOOD wins if the Imp is dead.\n- EVIL wins if the Imp is alive and only 2 players remain alive.\n\nROUND STRUCTURE\nNight (order):\n0) Chef (Good) — Night 1 only: Learn how many adjacent pairs of EVIL neighbors exist around the circle. (If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night's demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player's exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday's executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. (One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). Never reveal your exact role unless a prompt tells you to do so privately.\n- Output ONLY what each prompt asks for (often just a name or YES/NO).\n\nYou are Talia. Choose ONE player to nominate for execution today.\nAlive players: Talia, Nick, Peter, George, Enrique, Maria (you may nominate yourself or anyone alive)\n\nReply with ONLY the exact name."}]
Ollama Response: Nick
Ollama Request: [{'role': 'user', 'content': "You are playing BLOOD ON THE CLOCKTOWER (Trouble Brewing – Lite). Keep your secret role hidden.\n\nTEAMS & ROLES\n- GOOD (Townsfolk): Empath, FortuneTeller, Undertaker, Monk, Ravenkeeper, Chef, Slayer, Mayor\n- GOOD (Outsider): Butler\n- EVIL: Imp (Demon), Poisoner (Minion)\n\nWIN CONDITIONS\n- GOOD wins if the Imp is dead.\n- EVIL wins if the Imp is alive and only 2 players remain alive.\n\nROUND STRUCTURE\nNight (order):\n0) Chef (Good) — Night 1 only: Learn how many adjacent pairs of EVIL neighbors exist around the circle. (If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night's demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player's exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday's executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. (One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). Never reveal your exact role unless a prompt tells you to do so privately.\n- Output ONLY what each prompt asks for (often just a name or YES/NO).\n\nYou are Nick. Choose ONE player to nominate for execution today.\nAlive players: Talia, Nick, Peter, George, Enrique, Maria (you may nominate yourself or anyone alive)\n\nReply with ONLY the exact name."}]

(If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night's demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player's exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday's executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. (One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). Never reveal your exact role unless a prompt tells you to do so privately.\n- Output ONLY what each prompt asks for (often just a name or YES/NO).\n\nYou are Peter. Choose ONE player to nominate for execution today.\nAlive players: Talia, Nick, Peter, George, Enrique, Maria (you may nominate yourself or anyone alive)\n\nReply with ONLY the exact name."}]

Ollama Request: [{'role': 'user', 'content': "You are playing BLOOD ON THE CLOCKTOWER (Trouble Brewing – Lite). Keep your secret role hidden.\n\nTEAMS & ROLES\n- GOOD (Townsfolk): Empath, FortuneTeller, Undertaker, Monk, Ravenkeeper, Chef, Slayer, Mayor\n- GOOD (Outsider): Butler\n- EVIL: Imp (Demon), Poisoner (Minion)\n\nWIN CONDITIONS\n- GOOD wins if the Imp is dead.\n- EVIL wins if the Imp is alive and only 2 players remain alive.\n\nROUND STRUCTURE\nNight (order):\n0) Chef (Good) — Night 1 only: Learn how many adjacent pairs of EVIL neighbors exist around the circle. (If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night's demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player's exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday's executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. (One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). Never reveal your exact role unless a prompt tells you to do so privately.\n- Output ONLY what each prompt asks for (often just a name or YES/NO).\n\nYou are Enrique. The town is voting whether to execute Nick today.\nAlive players: Talia, Nick, Peter, George, Enrique, Maria\n\nReply with ONLY YES or NO."}]
Ollama Response: NO 

Enrique votes NO
Ollama Request: [{'role': 'user', 'content': "You are playing BLOOD ON THE CLOCKTOWER (Trouble Brewing – Lite). Keep your secret role hidden.\n\nTEAMS & ROLES\n- GOOD (Townsfolk): Empath, FortuneTeller, Undertaker, Monk, Ravenkeeper, Chef, Slayer, Mayor\n- GOOD (Outsider): Butler\n- EVIL: Imp (Demon), Poisoner (Minion)\n\nWIN CONDITIONS\n- GOOD wins if the Imp is dead.\n- EVIL wins if the Imp is alive and only 2 players remain alive.\n\nROUND STRUCTURE\nNight (order):\n0) Chef (Good) — Night 1 only: Learn how many adjacent pairs of EVIL neighbors exist around the circle. (If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night's demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player's exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday's executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. (One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). Never reveal your exact role unless a prompt tells you to do so privately.\n- Output ONLY what each prompt asks for (often just a name or YES/NO).\n\nYou are Maria. The town is voting whether to execute Nick today.\nAlive players: Talia, Nick, Peter, George, Enrique, Maria\n\nReply with ONLY YES or NO."}]
Ollama Response: NO
Maria votes NO

You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). Never reveal your exact role unless a prompt tells you to do so privately.\n- Output ONLY what each prompt asks for (often just a name or YES/NO).\n\nYou are Talia, the POISONER (Minion). Choose ONE player to poison tonight.\nPoisoned players receive false or unreliable information and may fail to protect/act correctly.\nAlive players: Nick, Peter, George, Enrique, Maria\n\nReply with ONLY the exact name."}]

Never reveal your exact role unless a prompt tells you to do so privately.\n- Output ONLY what each prompt asks for (often just a name or YES/NO).\n\nYou are Maria (keep your role secret).\nRecent discussion (latest last):\nTalia: I\'ll vote for Maria today. She seemed suspicious during our last discussions, and since Enrique\'s death, she\'s been acting a bit off. Let\'s see if removing her affects the dynamic.\nNick: "I agree Maria seems suspicious, let\'s vote her out today. But if it doesn\'t work, we should consider other options too."\nPeter: I think Maria is a strong candidate for execution, considering Talia\'s observations about her behavior after Enrique\'s death; it could be worth the risk to test that theory today during our vote. As Peter, I haven\'t made up my mind yet and will consider all angles before casting my vote in line with what Nick suggests—keeping an open mind until we see how things unfold at tonight\'s session.\nGeorge: I agree with Talia and Nick – Maria is definitely drawing attention. I’ll vote YES on her execution; it’s worth investigating her behavior further.\n\nGame state:\n- Last night death: Enrique\n- Alive (others): Talia, Nick, Peter, George\n- Day 6, Night 6\n\nYour private info hint: (none)\n\nSpeak as a real player (1–2 sentences):\n- React to 1–2 points from recent discussion by @name.\n- Say whether you\'d execute the current top suspect (name someone) and why.\n- Do not reveal your exact role.\n\nReply with ONLY your message text (no prefixes).'}]

Ollama Request: [{'role': 'user', 'content': 'You are playing BLOOD ON THE CLOCKTOWER (Trouble Brewing – Lite). Keep your secret role hidden.\n\nTEAMS & ROLES\n- GOOD (Townsfolk): Empath, FortuneTeller, Undertaker, Monk, Ravenkeeper, Chef, Slayer, Mayor\n- GOOD (Outsider): Butler\n- EVIL: Imp (Demon), Poisoner (Minion)\n\nWIN CONDITIONS\n- GOOD wins if the Imp is dead.\n- EVIL wins if the Imp is alive and only 2 players remain alive.\n\nROUND STRUCTURE\nNight (order):\n0) Chef (Good) — Night 1 only: Learn how many adjacent pairs of EVIL neighbors exist around the circle. (If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night\'s demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player\'s exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday\'s executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. (One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). Never reveal your exact role unless a prompt tells you to do so privately.\n- Output ONLY what each prompt asks for (often just a name or YES/NO).\n\nYou are Talia (keep your role secret).\nRecent discussion (latest last):\nTalia: I\'ll vote for Maria today. Ollama Request: [{'role': 'user', 'content': "You are playing BLOOD ON THE CLOCKTOWER (Trouble Brewing – Lite). Keep your secret role hidden.\n\nTEAMS & ROLES\n- GOOD (Townsfolk): Empath, FortuneTeller, Undertaker, Monk, Ravenkeeper, Chef, Slayer, Mayor\n- GOOD (Outsider): Butler\n- EVIL: Imp (Demon), Poisoner (Minion)\n\nWIN CONDITIONS\n- GOOD wins if the Imp is dead.\n- EVIL wins if the Imp is alive and only 2 players remain alive.\n\nROUND STRUCTURE\nNight (order):\n0) Chef (Good) — Night 1 only: Learn how many adjacent pairs of EVIL neighbors exist around the circle. (If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night's demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player's exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday's executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. (One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). Never reveal your exact role unless a prompt tells you to do so privately.\n- Output ONLY what each prompt asks for (often just a name or YES/NO).\n\nYou are Talia. Choose ONE player to nominate for execution today.\nAlive players: Talia, Nick, Peter, George, Maria (you may nominate yourself or anyone alive)\n\nReply with ONLY the exact name."}]
Ollama Response: Nick
Ollama Request: [{'role': 'user', 'content': "You are playing BLOOD ON THE CLOCKTOWER (Trouble Brewing – Lite). Keep your secret role hidden.\n\nTEAMS & ROLES\n- GOOD (Townsfolk): Empath, FortuneTeller, Undertaker, Monk, Ravenkeeper, Chef, Slayer, Mayor\n- GOOD (Outsider): Butler\n- EVIL: Imp (Demon), Poisoner (Minion)\n\nWIN CONDITIONS\n- GOOD wins if the Imp is dead.\n- EVIL wins if the Imp is alive and only 2 players remain alive.\n\nROUND STRUCTURE\nNight (order):\n0) Chef (Good) — Night 1 only: Learn how many adjacent pairs of EVIL neighbors exist around the circle. (If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night's demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player's exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday's executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. (One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). Never reveal your exact role unless a prompt tells you to do so privately.\n- Output ONLY what each prompt asks for (often just a name or YES/NO).\n\nYou are Nick. Choose ONE player to nominate for execution today.\nAlive players: Talia, Nick, Peter, George, Maria (you may nominate yourself or anyone alive)\n\nReply with ONLY the exact name."}]
Ollama Response: Talia

(If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night's demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player's exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday's executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. (One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). Never reveal your exact role unless a prompt tells you to do so privately.\n- Output ONLY what each prompt asks for (often just a name or YES/NO).\n\nYou are Peter. Choose ONE player to nominate for execution today.\nAlive players: Talia, Nick, Peter, George, Maria (you may nominate yourself or anyone alive)\n\nReply with ONLY the exact name."}]

(If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night's demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player's exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday's executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. (One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). (If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night's demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player's exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday's executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. (One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). Never reveal your exact role unless a prompt tells you to do so privately.\n- Output ONLY what each prompt asks for (often just a name or YES/NO).\n\nYou are Talia, the POISONER (Minion). Choose ONE player to poison tonight.\nPoisoned players receive false or unreliable information and may fail to protect/act correctly.\nAlive players: Nick, Peter, George, Maria\n\nReply with ONLY the exact name."}]
Ollama Response: Nick

Execution should be based on concrete evidence rather than coincidence or mere connections. While Talia's instinct is valuable, let's not forget that our butler may have his own reasons for George's demise which might involve deception beyond Nick’s reach. As the Mayor of this town and with due consideration to everyone's safety, I propose we gather more information before casting any vote on execution today.

As Peter: With no personal motives at play from my end, it seems judicious for us as a council under guidance by our Monk protector not to hastily condemn Nick without further evidence of his guilt or connection with George's demise and the butler’s machinations. Let Talia present her case within proper bounds so that we can deliberate thoroughly, bearing in mind all roles at play—including possibly misleading information due to poisoning from our Poisoner ally-enemy among us. We must remain vigilant with whom each other trusts and the potential for deceit by those who may seem like friends but are secreted as foes or informants, including outsiders such as ourselves under Butler's directive.

As Peter: Reflecting on Talia’s instinct to act upon Nick based on his link with George—who met a grim fate at nightfall by our Imp and Poisoner allies — it is indeed essential for us not only survive but also ensure justice prevails within these troubled times. Let us proceed with caution; after all, in these trying times of uncertainty on Blood Tower's Clocktower, it is not only survival but also ensuring that justice prevails where there may be deceit and treachery at play among those who seem to dwell amongst the innocent townsfolk.
